intro: Styphelia tamminensis, commonly known as the slender mountain heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the wet tropical forests of northeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, dense foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Styphelia tamminensis thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a humid, shaded environment to flourish. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
